info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 5:46PM EDT until July 28 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... Northwestern Culpeper County in northern Virginia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 546 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sperryville, or 13 miles northwest of Culpeper, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Sperryville, Castleton, Five Forks, Rock Mills, Viewtown, Woodville, Hackleys Crossroads and Amissville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
